articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Should billionaires be able to buy their way into presidential campaigns?
articles.description: Lawrence O’Donnell asks Democratic presidential candidate and billionaire Tom Steyer - who has already spent $67 million on TV advertising - about campaign finance reform.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What happens when Trump goes off prompter
articles.description: Lawrence O'Donnell looks at the “insanity” of President Trump saying he wants NATO expanded to include the Middle East and renamed "NATO-ME.”

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: The future of the Trump ‘cult’
articles.description: NY Magazine writer-at-large Frank Rich tells Lawrence O'Donnell that history shows Republicans working for, enabling and defending Donald Trump will pay a reputation price because “with time, everything will come out - it always does.”
articles.content: NY Magazine writer-at-large Frank Rich tells Lawrence O'Donnell that history shows Republicans working for, enabling and defending Donald Trump will pay a reputation price because with time, everything will come out - it always does.Jan. 10, 2020

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Another Clinton investigation championed by Trump comes up empty
articles.description: Rachel Maddow shares a report from the Washington Post that a two-year investigation begun by then-A.G. Jeff Sessions at the behest of Donald Trump and his right-wing supporters to investigate pet theories about the Clinton Foundation and the sale of Uranium …

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Iran plane crash apparently the consequence of stoked hostilities
articles.description: Rachel Maddow notes new reporting that the Ukrainian passenger jet that crashed in Iran this week was likely shot down by an Iranian anti-aircraft rocket, likely by mistake, in the tense aftermath of Iran having launched missiles in retaliation for Donald Tru…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: What Tom Steyer saw early on about impeaching Donald Trump
articles.description: Lawrence O’Donnell asks presidential candidate Tom Steyer about launching a grassroots movement to push for Trump’s impeachment back in October 2017 and watching impeachment happen.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump offers new defense for strike on Iranian general
articles.description: Trump now says he ordered the drone strike killing Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani because he was plotting to blow up U.S. embassies.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Shifting explanations raises questions about trump admin Intel on Iran
articles.description: As the White House offers the latest reason for killing Soleimani, there are new concerns Iran may not be done retaliating against the U.S. Susan Page, Jeremy Bash, and Jonathan Lemire join.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Hardball 1/9/20
articles.description: Chris Matthews and a panel of guests discuss the political news of the day.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Dem Rep. Kaptur: Impeachment must have process ‘whereby the truth can be known.’
articles.description: Rep. Marcy Kaptur praises Nancy Pelosi for holding the articles of impeachment, saying that new Ukraine information has come to light before the Senate trial has begun thanks to that move. She tells Lawrence O’Donnell that what Pelosi is doing is "very proper…
articles.content: Rep. Marcy Kaptur praises Nancy Pelosi for holding the articles of impeachment, saying that new Ukraine information has come to light before the Senate trial has begun thanks to that move. She tells Lawrence ODonnell that what Pelosi is doing is "very proper.… [+13 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Bloomberg, Steyer ad spending dwarfs rest of 2020 field -by a lot
articles.description: Rachel Maddow shows the sheer scale of the difference between what Michael Bloomberg and Tom Steyer have spent on TV and radio ads so far in the 2020 campaign versus every other candidate in the race that has spent more than a million dollars, including Donal…
